newtfourie.com.google.plus.datautils.date

Class DateTimeConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • newtfourie.com.google.plus.datautils.date.DateTimeConverter

  • public class DateTimeConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used to convert gregorian calendar dates into string and vice versa This class can also be used to get time as a string
    Author:
    Newt

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareDateStrings(java.lang.String dateOne, java.lang.String dateTwo)

      This method will compare the two times provided in a string format as (hh:mm:ss).

      • convertDateToString

        public java.lang.String convertDateToString(java.util.GregorianCalendar calendar)
        Converts the provided calendar into a string formatted date This method excludes time and only returns a date formatted as a string
        Parameters:
        calendar - - the calendar to use
        Returns:
        - a date formatted as a string

      • convertDateToCalendar

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar convertDateToCalendar(java.lang.String dateString)
                                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        Tokenization of the date string needs to be done outside of this method. This method only accepts a date string in the format yyyy-MM-dd
        Parameters:
        dateString - - the string to convert to gregorian calendar
        Returns:
        - a gregorian calendar result from the string provided
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - - if the provided string is of the incorrect format

      • convertTimeToCalendar

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar convertTimeToCalendar(java.lang.String timeString)
                                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        Tokenization of the time string needs to be done outside of this method. This method only accepts a time string in the format hh:mm:ss
        Parameters:
        timeString - - the string to convert to gregorian calendar
        Returns:
        - a gregorian calendar result from the string provided
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - - if the provided string is of the incorrect format

      • dayDifference

        public long dayDifference(java.lang.String calendar,
                 java.lang.String oldCalendar)
                   throws java.text.ParseException
        This method will calculate the number of days difference between the two calendars provided. It will take calendar - oldCalendar and calculate how many days are between them IMPORTANT: this method expects the date to be in the format yyyy-MM-dd this format is provided by the convertDateToString(java.util.GregorianCalendar)
        Parameters:
        calendar - - the first calendar as a string
        oldCalendar - - the second calendar as a string
        Returns:
        number of days as a result from calendar - oldCalendar
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • dayDifference

        public long dayDifference(java.util.GregorianCalendar calendar,
                 java.util.GregorianCalendar oldCalendar)
        This method will calculate the number of days difference between the two calendars provided. It will take calendar - oldCalendar and calculate how many days are between them
        Parameters:
        calendar - - the first calendar as a string
        oldCalendar - - the second calendar as a string
        Returns:
        number of days as a result from calendar - oldCalendar

      • compareDateStrings

        public int compareDateStrings(java.lang.String dateOne,
                     java.lang.String dateTwo)
                       throws java.text.ParseException
        This method will compare the two dates provided in a string format as (yyyy-MM-dd). see convertDateToString(GregorianCalendar) It follows the normal compare standard whereby it will return val > 0 if dateOne > dateTwo return val = 0 if dateOne = dateTwo return val < 0 if dateOne < dateTwo
        Parameters:
        dateOne - - the first date to compare
        dateTwo - - the second date to compare
        Returns:
        a comparison integer
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - - if the string date's provided are not in the correct format

      • compareTimeStrings

        public int compareTimeStrings(java.lang.String timeOne,
                     java.lang.String timeTwo)
                       throws java.text.ParseException
        This method will compare the two times provided in a string format as (hh:mm:ss). see getTimeFromCalendar(GregorianCalendar) It follows the normal compare standard whereby it will return val > 0 if timeOne > timeTwo return val = 0 if timeOne = timeTwo return val < 0 if timeOne < timeTwo
        Parameters:
        dateOne - - the first time to compare
        dateTwo - - the second time to compare
        Returns:
        a comparison integer
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - - if the string time's provided are not in the correct format
